src.test_suite package¶

Submodules¶

src.test_suite.functions module¶

src.test_suite.functions.generate_alphas_betas_and_gammas(days, run_name)¶

This function generates a .csv file containing a set sample set of ground truth values of \(\alpha\), \(\beta\) and \(\gamma\) for however many days we choose. These three parameters can be used to generate a set of fake observations of NO2 and CH4 for the given day.

Parameters

  • days (int) – The number of days we want to generate a set of alpha, beta and gamma for.

  • run_name (string) – The name of the run.

src.test_suite.functions.generate_dataset(run_name)¶

This function generates a .csv file that contains the total set of fake observations over all of the fake days that we wanted, using the ground truth values of \(\alpha\), \(\beta\) and \(\gamma\) contained in “ground_truths/run_name/alphas_betas_gammas.csv”

Parameters

run_name (string) – The name of the run.

src.test_suite.functions.generate_mu_and_Sigma(run_name)¶

This function generates a .csv file that defines the “ground truth” values that we use to generate a set of test data.

Parameters

run_name (string) – The name of the run.

src.test_suite.functions.make_directories(run_name)¶

This function checks that all the relevant directories are made. If you re-use a run name, the directory and previous contents will be deleted, and the directory will be created again WITHOUT WARNING.

Parameters

run_name – The name of the run, will also be the name of the folders that is created.

:type run_name string

src.test_suite.functions.prepare_dataset_for_cmdstanpy(run_name)¶

This function takes the “dataset.cvs” file located at “test_suite/ground_truths/run_name” and turns it into json that is suitable for usage by the cmdstanpy package (.csv files are unabled to be provided as data when we fit our models).

Parameters

run_name – Name of the model run.

:type run_name:str
